title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has incorrect usage of Class.forName()
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has incorrect usage of Class.forName() method in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class. This causes a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT and needs to be fixed.
OB: When using jxeLink or similar methods, a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown when executing a line of code in the org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class that uses the Class.forName() method. This issue is not caught by the eclipse compiler or Sun's compiler.
EB: The usage of Class.forName() method in the BidiUtil class should be removed to avoid the NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink or similar methods to execute the code in the org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class.
3. Observe that a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown due to the usage of Class.forName() method.

Expected behavior: The code should execute without any NoClassDefFoundError when using the CLDC version of SWT.
